Package com.ee364project

Class CallCenter

java.lang.Object
com.ee364project.CallCenter
All Implemented Interfaces:
Simulated
public class CallCenter extends Object implements Simulated
Represents a simulated call center with agents, call handling, and availability tracking. This class models the behavior of a call center, managing agents, call assignments, and availability. It is part of a simulation and implements the Simulated interface for time-based steps. Fields:
  • HashMap<Agent, Boolean> agentAvailability: A mapping of agents to their availability status.
  • LinkedList<Agent> availableAgents: A linked list containing available agents.
  • MainSceneController msc: The main scene controller for the call center simulation.
  • static CallCenter callCenter: The static instance of the CallCenter.
Since:
2023-12-21
Version:
1.0
Author:
Team 2

  • Constructor Details

    • CallCenter

      public CallCenter(Agent[] agents)
      Constructs a CallCenter object with the given array of agents. Initializes the list of available agents and sets their initial availability status to true. The constructed CallCenter instance is then assigned to the static callCenter field for global access.
      Parameters:
      agents - An array of Agent objects representing the agents available in the call center.

  • Method Details

    • getCallCentre

      public static CallCenter getCallCentre()
      Retrieves the global instance of the CallCenter. This method provides access to the singleton instance of the CallCenter class, allowing external classes to obtain information about the call center's state and configuration.
      Returns:
      The global instance of the CallCenter.

    • getAvailableAgentsCount

      public int getAvailableAgentsCount()
      Retrieves the current count of available agents in the call center.
      Returns:
      The number of agents currently available in the call center.

    • getAvailableAgents

      public Agent[] getAvailableAgents()
      Retrieves an array containing the currently available agents in the call center.
      Returns:
      An array of Agent objects representing the agents currently available in the call center.

    • getUnavailableAgents

      public Agent[] getUnavailableAgents()
      Retrieves an array containing the currently unavailable agents in the call center.
      Returns:
      An array of Agent objects representing the agents currently unavailable in the call center.

    • getUnavailableAgentsCount

      public int getUnavailableAgentsCount()
      Retrieves the current count of unavailable agents in the call center.
      Returns:
      The number of agents currently unavailable in the call center.

    • releaseAgent

      public void releaseAgent(Agent agent)
      Releases the specified agent, marking them as available for handling tasks or calls.
      Parameters:
      agent - The Agent object to be released.

    • assignAgent

      public Agent assignAgent()
      Assigns an available agent for handling a task or call. The assigned agent is removed from the list of available agents and marked as unavailable for further assignments.
      Returns:
      The Agent object that has been assigned for the task or call.

    • step

      public void step()
      Executes a single step in the simulation, attempting to match available agents with incoming calls. If there are available agents, it retrieves an incoming call and assigns the best available agent to handle it. The method then updates the call receiver and notifies the MainSceneController about the connecting call. If no calls are available but there are agents, the method takes appropriate action.
      Specified by:
      step in interface Simulated
